article: When your mother want to tell you something, she uses words. Birds can't speak 1.  as  we do, but some birds can make sounds to warn their young of 2.  _  .They have 3.  _  own way of making the young birds do certain things. The jackdaw is a kind of black bird4.  _  lives in Europe. Jackdaws live together in flocks. Young jackdaws do not know their enemies. When an old jackdaw sees a dog, it makes a loud rattling5.  _  .The young birds know this sound means6.  an enemy  is nearby. The sound warns them7.  to know  their enemies. 8.  _  a young jackdaw is in a 9  _  place, a jackdaw parent 50.  will fly  over the young bird's back from behind. The parent's tail feathers move 11.  _  from side to side. It's trying to say "12  Follow me  ".At the same time, the 13.  _  bird calls out Key-aw Key-aw, which seems to say FLY HOME WITH ME. The young bird then follows the older14  _  to go home. Young jackdaws15.  don't have to  learn what certain sounds mean. They know the meaning of these sounds from they hatch.
